info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Caldwell and central Burke Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Morganton, or 4 miles southeast of Table Rock, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morganton, Gamewell, Drexel, Lake Rhodhiss, Table Rock, Valdese, Rutherford College and Oak Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
